title: Workshop on Instructional Design for Explaining Molecular and Cellular Mechanisms

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Biology Knowledge and Fundamental Instructional Design Concepts
context.additional_context: A short-term intensive course for pre-service/in-service teachers to enhance instructional design competencies based on the MACH model, conducted in a smartphone-centric limited technology environment.

learning_goals: The four components of the MACH model (Methods, Analogies, Context, How) can be applied to explain biological mechanisms
Instructional materials can be designed to simplify complex molecular/cellular mechanisms according to learners' proficiency levels
Instructional design plans developed through project-based approaches can be revised based on peer and expert feedback

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
